original: de bas na rjes su dpag bas gnod ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag bas gnod ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not undermined by inference.

original: don dam pa zhes bya bar khyad par du byas pas dngos por grags pa rnams la bsnyon pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir grags pas gnod pa yang med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya bar khyad par du byas pas dngos por grags pa rnams la bsnyon pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir grags pas gnod pa yang med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Since it is qualified as ‚Äúultimate,‚Äù it is not undermined by what is renowned, because it does not contradict what is renowned.

original: de ltar na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Thus, this is not a problem.

original: sa bon med par 'khrul ba mi rigs bas na des sgro btags pa'i rnam pa ci ltar yin zhes kyang brjod bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon med par 'khrul ba mi rigs bas na des sgro btags pa'i rnam pa ci ltar yin zhes kyang brjod bar mi bya ste /
translated: Since it is illogical for an error to occur without a seed, one should not say, ‚ÄúHow can it be an aspect that is superimposed?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bden pa dang brdzun ba'i 'khrul pa lhan cig 'brel ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bden pa dang brdzun ba'i 'khrul pa lhan cig 'brel ba ci zhig yod /
translated: What connection can there be between a true and a false error?

original: re zhig de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the same,

original: bden pa dang brdzun pa dag ni 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang brdzun pa dag ni 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because truth and falsity are contradictory.

original: de las byung ba yang ma yin te brdzun pa ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las byung ba yang ma yin te brdzun pa ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor do they arise from it, because falsity is not a result.

original: de bas na 'di'i nye bar len ba ni kun rdzob pa snga ma kho na yin pas 'gal ba med la /
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i nye bar len ba ni kun rdzob pa snga ma kho na yin pas 'gal ba med la /
translated: Therefore, since the prior conventional is its appropriator, there is no contradiction.

original: rgyu de'i rgyu yang kun rdzob pa snga ma kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i rgyu yang kun rdzob pa snga ma kho na yin te /
translated: The cause of that cause is only the former superficial reality.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu brgyud pa ni thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa med pa'i 'khrul ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rgyu brgyud pa ni thog ma med pa can yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa med pa'i 'khrul ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the series of causes of that kind is beginningless, there is no error without appropriation.

original: ji ltar so sor nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar so sor nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it determined?

original: brjod pa dngos po yang dag pa'i ngo bo dang 'dra bar kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin yang 'di nyid de /
analyzed: brjod pa dngos po yang dag pa'i ngo bo dang 'dra bar kun rdzob pa'i rang bzhin yang 'di nyid de /
translated: It is said that the nature of the superficial reality is like the nature of the real entity.

original: kun rdzob pa'i rgyu gzhan la rag las nas @237b so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu kun rdzob pa byed pa zhes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i rgyu gzhan la rag las nas @237b so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu kun rdzob pa byed pa zhes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the superficial result that is determined by the dependence on another superficial cause.

original: 'o na ji ltar kun rdzob yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar kun rdzob yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how is it superficial?

original: don gyi bya ba byed nus pa'i dngos po nyid rnam par dpyad pa'i spungs mi bzod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed nus pa'i dngos po nyid rnam par dpyad pa'i spungs mi bzod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: It is called superficial because it is an entity that is able to perform a function, but is unable to withstand ultimate analysis.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa dang yang dag ba ma yin pa dag gis dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa dang yang dag ba ma yin pa dag gis dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the real and the unreal pervade all entities.

original: de dag kyang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bden pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa na shugs kyis cig shos su gnas pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir bden pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa na shugs kyis cig shos su gnas pa 'thob ste /
translated: Since they are characteristics that are mutually exclusive, when the reality of true existence is refuted, the other is implicitly established.

original: de bas na rang bzhin 'di ni dngos po thams cad kyis rang gi bdag gis byas pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin 'di ni dngos po thams cad kyis rang gi bdag gis byas pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since this nature is produced by all things themselves, there is no fault.

original: gtan tshigs med par 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pas chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs yongs su 'dzin par byed bas ni de yod pa nyid du khas blangs ba yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med par 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pas chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs yongs su 'dzin par byed bas ni de yod pa nyid du khas blangs ba yin la /
translated: Since it is maintained that an object of affirmation is not established without a reason, in order to establish that all phenomena are just unreal, you accept a reason.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med bar dam bcas pa ni med do zhes khas blangs bas phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir rang gi ma mo gsham yin pa nyid du dam 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med bar dam bcas pa ni med do zhes khas blangs bas phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir rang gi ma mo gsham yin pa nyid du dam 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no /
translated: But you do not accept that all phenomena are natureless, and since you accept that they are nonexistent, you contradict yourself, just as if you were to accept that your mother is a barren woman.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ni de nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid ma yin la gzhan dag gis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ni de nyid kyi dngos po med pa nyid ma yin la gzhan dag gis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself, the reason is not the nonexistence of that thing itself, nor is it the nonexistence of something else.

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is contradictory for something to act on itself, then the consequence is that there is an infinite regress.

original: ma yin te ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang de las yin zhing bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan smras zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang de las yin zhing bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan smras zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because we have already responded to this by saying that the nonexistence of intrinsic reality is from that and it is not contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang kun rdzob tu las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba rnam par 'jog pas lung dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de dang 'gal bar 'gyur bar yang mi brtag go //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang kun rdzob tu las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel ba rnam par 'jog pas lung dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de dang 'gal bar 'gyur bar yang mi brtag go //
translated: Thus, although there is no intrinsic reality, we posit the relationship between karma and effects conventionally. Therefore, because there is no contradiction with scripture, you should not imagine that there is a contradiction with scripture.

original: 'on te dngos po med par smra ba rnams la don thams cad med bas gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni bzlog par dka' ba yin no snyam du sems na de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med par smra ba rnams la don thams cad med bas gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa ni bzlog par dka' ba yin no snyam du sems na de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that it is difficult to reverse the faults of the subject not being established and so on for those who propound nonexistence because all objects would be nonexistent, that is not so.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad thams cad ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i grub pa'i mthas bzhag pa'i chos kyi dbye ba spangs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad thams cad ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i grub pa'i mthas bzhag pa'i chos kyi dbye ba spangs nas /
translated: Thus, all conventions of inferor and inferred are engaged in dependence upon a subject that is renowned to ordinary beings, having abandoned the differentiation of phenomena that is posited by a philosophical position that is mutually contradictory.

original: byis pa'i skye bo'i bar la grags pa'i chos can la brten nas 'jug pa yin la de dang 'brel ba'i gtan tshigs dang dpe yang de bzhin du grub pa yin no //üîΩgzhan du na gal te grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i gtan tshigs sam chos can nam dper 'gyur ba yin na de'i tshe grub pa'i mtha' @238a * //
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo'i bar la grags pa'i chos can la brten nas 'jug pa yin la de dang 'brel ba'i gtan tshigs dang dpe yang de bzhin du grub pa yin no // gzhan du na gal te grub pa'i mtha' la brten pa'i gtan tshigs sam chos can nam dper 'gyur ba yin na de'i tshe grub pa'i mtha' @238a * //
translated: The reason and example that are related to that are also established in the same way.

original: gcig la grags pa'i khyad par gyis khyad bar du byas pa'i chos can ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la grags pa'i khyad par gyis khyad bar du byas pa'i chos can ni rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, if the reason, subject, or example were based on a philosophical position, then at that time, because the subject that is distinguished by the distinctions renowned in one philosophical position is the basis of the debate, it would not be established for the other.

original: de ltar na khyad par can gyi chos can ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na khyad par can gyi chos can ma grub pas gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, because the distinguished subject is not established, the reason would be a reason with an unestablished basis.

original: de bzhin du rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa la de'i chos can yang ma grub pa yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa la de'i chos can yang ma grub pa yin pas /
translated: Likewise, if the nature of something is not established, then the subject of that is also not established.

original: du ba dang yod pa la sogs pa dag las me dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par shes pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub ba'i tha snyad thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: du ba dang yod pa la sogs pa dag las me dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs par shes pa med pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub ba'i tha snyad thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, since there is no knowledge of fire and impermanence, etc., from smoke and existence, etc., all conventions of probandum and proof would be interrupted.

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las ldog pa'i shes pa tsam la sogs pa 'ga' zhig grub pa'i phyir te de bas na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las ldog pa'i shes pa tsam la sogs pa 'ga' zhig grub pa'i phyir te de bas na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: But this is not so, because some things are established, such as mere consciousness that is the opposite of the nature of nonconsciousness, etc.

original: 'di snyam du gang zhig chos can snang bzhin pa la brten nas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa'i phyir sgrub byed sbyor bar byed pa de la ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i glags mi rnyed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang zhig chos can snang bzhin pa la brten nas sgro btags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa'i phyir sgrub byed sbyor bar byed pa de la ni gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i glags mi rnyed pa yin na /
translated: If one objects, ‚ÄúIf one applies a proof in order to refute the superimposition that is superimposed on the apparent subject, then one cannot be faulted by the charge of unestablished basis, etc.,

original: khyod kyis ni chos can snang bzhin pa nyid la 'gog par byed de de bas na khyod la ji ltar gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i glags mi thod do zhe na /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni chos can snang bzhin pa nyid la 'gog par byed de de bas na khyod la ji ltar gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pa'i glags mi thod do zhe na /
translated: You refute the apparent subject itself, and therefore you cannot be faulted for having a nonestablished subject.

original: de lta ma yin te 'di ltar don dam pa zhes khyad par du byas pas chos can snang ba 'di la sgro btags pa bden par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'di ltar don dam pa zhes khyad par du byas pas chos can snang ba 'di la sgro btags pa bden par yod pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That is not so. Since the ultimate is specified, the subject that appears is established as the probandum, the negation of the reality that is the superimposed true existence.

original: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo ni 'gog pa ma yin pas mtshungs so //üîΩ'on te don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin bkag na gang zhig snang bas chos can de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba lus pa gzhan ci zhig yod ces bya bar 'dod na de yang yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo ni 'gog pa ma yin pas mtshungs so // 'on te don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin bkag na gang zhig snang bas chos can de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba lus pa gzhan ci zhig yod ces bya bar 'dod na de yang yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The subject‚Äôs own nature is not refuted, so the two cases are not similar.üîΩIf you assert that if the ultimate nature is refuted, then since it appears, what other nature remains that would be the subject‚Äôs nature? That is not correct.

original: gang gis de log na ldog par 'gyur ba don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba la khyab pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de log na ldog par 'gyur ba don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin gyi snang ba la khyab pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of the ultimate nature does not pervade all that is seen, since it is not seen by all who see it.

original: zla ba gnyis dang skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis dang skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the false, such as the two moons and the falling hair, also appear.

original: 'di skad du gal te yang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa dag phyir rol gyi rang bzhin du brdzun pa yin mod /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te yang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa dag phyir rol gyi rang bzhin du brdzun pa yin mod /
translated: It cannot be said that although the two moons, etc. are false in the nature of the external object,

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni de dag don dam pa pa yin pa des na snang bar 'thad pa yin no zhes kyang brjod bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni de dag don dam pa pa yin pa des na snang bar 'thad pa yin no zhes kyang brjod bar mi nus te /
translated: they are ultimately the nature of consciousness, and therefore it is tenable that they appear,

original: de dag ni sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can dang yul ni gnas par nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin can dang yul ni gnas par nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appear as having a nature of variety and as abiding in a place.

original: shes pa gcig ni sna tshogs par mi 'thad de gcig nyid nyams bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig ni sna tshogs par mi 'thad de gcig nyid nyams bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that a single consciousness has a variety, because it would follow that it would lose its oneness.

original: shes ba du mar skye ba yang sngar bkag pa'i phyir @238b ro ;
analyzed: shes ba du mar skye ba yang sngar bkag pa'i phyir @238b ro ;
translated: And the arising of many consciousnesses has already been refuted.

original: / yul na gnas pa yang ma yin te lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yul na gnas pa yang ma yin te lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor do they abide in the object, because they are not physical.

original: de bas na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa ni don dam pa ma yin mod kyi de lta na yang snang ba des don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin log kyang snang ba nyid ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pas de kho na nyid kyi dngos porüîΩkhas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa ni don dam pa ma yin mod kyi de lta na yang snang ba des don dam pa pa'i rang bzhin log kyang snang ba nyid ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin pas de kho na nyid kyi dngos por khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, do not accept it as a thing that is reality.

original: dngos po med par yang khas blang bar mi bya ste de ni dngos po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med par yang khas blang bar mi bya ste de ni dngos po ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, do not accept it as a nonthing, because that is characterized by the negation of a thing.

original: dngos po ma grub na yul med pa'i dgag pa ni yod pa ma yin pas dgag par bya ba med na bkag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba can de yang ma grub po //
analyzed: dngos po ma grub na yul med pa'i dgag pa ni yod pa ma yin pas dgag par bya ba med na bkag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba can de yang ma grub po //
translated: If a thing is not established, a negation that lacks an object does not exist, and if the object of negation does not exist, the negation does not apply. Therefore, that which precedes it is not established.

original: mtha' gcig tu gyur pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i phyogs las byung ba'i nyes pas kho bo cag la mi gos pa des na phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gcig bkag pa med na mi 'byung ba gzhan chos can sgrub pa
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu gyur pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i phyogs las byung ba'i nyes pas kho bo cag la mi gos pa des na phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gcig bkag pa med na mi 'byung ba gzhan chos can sgrub pa
translated: Since we are not tainted by the faults arising from the positions of existence and nonexistence, therefore, since they are mutually exclusive by nature, the negation of one is the affirmation of the other.

original: can nan gyis grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'bral te /
analyzed: can nan gyis grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'bral te /
translated: This is the point of the argument.

original: de kho na nyid du na dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par bcad du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du na dngos po'i ngo bo rnam par bcad du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not so, because in reality the nature of things cannot be eliminated.

original: de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa na yang mngon sum mam brgyud pas kyang shes ba dang shes bya dag 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa na yang mngon sum mam brgyud pas kyang shes ba dang shes bya dag 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the nature of things and nonthings does not exist, cognition and the object of cognition engage in a relationship, either directly or indirectly.

original: de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa dag rnam pa thams cad du de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa dag rnam pa thams cad du de kho na nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the conceptual consciousnesses that are their subjects are not reality in any way.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med na yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'dra bar skye'o zhes kyang bsam par mi
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid med na yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'dra bar skye'o zhes kyang bsam par mi
translated: But you should not think that if things and nonthings do not intrinsically exist, then the conceptual consciousness that apprehends them arises like the conception of a rabbit‚Äôs horns, that is, as a conception that is not related to its object.

original: bya ste / 'di ltar gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang 'brel pa med mod /üîΩde lta na yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i bag chags sad pa las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi shes pa la de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: bya ste / 'di ltar gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams dang 'brel pa med mod / de lta na yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i bag chags sad pa las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir sngon gyi shes pa la de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: This is because, although external things are not related to the consciousness that perceives them,üîΩthe consciousness arises from the activation of predispositions that are not different from it. Therefore, the consciousness is related to its object in the sense that it arises from it.

original: de bzhin du dus mnyam par byung ba'i shes pa de dang tha mi dad pa nyid la yang de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus mnyam par byung ba'i shes pa de dang tha mi dad pa nyid la yang de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the consciousness that arises simultaneously with the object is related to it in the sense that it has the same nature as it.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi tha snyad du byed pa yin no //üîΩdes na ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bag chags las byung ba'i shes pa med na de'i gzugs brnyan dang bral @239a * //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi tha snyad du byed pa yin no // des na ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bag chags las byung ba'i shes pa med na de'i gzugs brnyan dang bral @239a * //
translated: Therefore, in regard to the image that is based on conceptual thought, one can make assertions and denials in regard to some of its aspects.

original: ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ma skyes pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang gi ngo bo med par rnam par rtog pa zhes gang las brjod par bya /
analyzed: ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ma skyes pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang gi ngo bo med par rnam par rtog pa zhes gang las brjod par bya /
translated: Thus, if there were no cognition that arises from latent impressions in the manner that has been explained, then, because it would be free from the image of that, conceptual thought would not arise. Therefore, in regard to what would one say that conceptual thought has no intrinsic reality, whether it be an existent or a non-existent?

original: 'dis ni kha cig na re rtog pa dang ldan pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i don la bden pa nyid dang / gzhan dag la ni brdzun pa nyid du mngon par zhen par rigs te gzhan du na rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni kha cig na re rtog pa dang ldan pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i don la bden pa nyid dang / gzhan dag la ni brdzun pa nyid du mngon par zhen par rigs te gzhan du na rtog pa dang ldan pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, some believe that it is proper to adhere to the notion that the object established by a valid cognition that is associated with conceptual thought is real and that other objects are unreal, otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that one would not be associated with conceptual thought.

original: de bas na bden pa dang brdzun pa la mngon par zhen pa ni spang bar dka' ba yin pas phyin ci log thams cad ci ltar spang bar 'gyur zhes zer ba de'i yang lan btab pa yin te mngon par zhen pa ni shes pa dang tha mi dad
analyzed: de bas na bden pa dang brdzun pa la mngon par zhen pa ni spang bar dka' ba yin pas phyin ci log thams cad ci ltar spang bar 'gyur zhes zer ba de'i yang lan btab pa yin te mngon par zhen pa ni shes pa dang tha mi dad
translated: Therefore, since it is difficult to abandon attachment to truth and falsity, the response to the question, ‚ÄúHow could all errors be abandoned?‚Äù

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de med pa na /
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de med pa na /
translated: is that since attachment is not a different entity from consciousness,

original: mngon par zhen pa yod par 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur /üîΩdes na de ltar dngos po dang dngos bo med pa'i rtog pa dag gis rnam par rtog pa thams cad la khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba yang med bas de kho na nyid du na dngos po dang dngos
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa yod par 'thad par ji ltar 'gyur / des na de ltar dngos po dang dngos bo med pa'i rtog pa dag gis rnam par rtog pa thams cad la khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med na khyab par bya ba yang med bas de kho na nyid du na dngos po dang dngos
translated: how could it be tenable that attachment exists when it does not?

original: po med par yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: po med par yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
translated: Thus, since the conceptions of things and nonthings pervade all conceptions, if the pervader does not exist, the pervaded also does not exist. Therefore, in reality, the wise are free from grasping things and nonthings.

original: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba chu shing gi phung po dang 'dra bar phyi dang nang na snying po med pa nyid kyi dngos po rnams thams cad la /
analyzed: ma brtags na nyams dga' ba chu shing gi phung po dang 'dra bar phyi dang nang na snying po med pa nyid kyi dngos po rnams thams cad la /
translated: Like a pile of plantain trees, they are delightful when not examined, but like a plantain trunk, they are without any essence either outside or inside.üîΩWhen the power of meditation is perfected by means of the eye of wisdom that realizes the eight realizations, such as the knowledge of all aspects, with regard to all things,

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi tshul du shes rab kyi mig gis nges par rtogs pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na 'ga' zhig gi nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi tshul du shes rab kyi mig gis nges par rtogs pa'i bsgom pa'i stobs rdzogs pa na 'ga' zhig gi nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar
translated: then, like the knowledge of jewels, silver, and so on of some,

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma ma lus bar spangs pa nyid kyis rang bzhin tshad mar gyur pa na yang dag pa'i don ji ltar ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma ma lus bar spangs pa nyid kyis rang bzhin tshad mar gyur pa na yang dag pa'i don ji ltar ba bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: the signs of error are completely abandoned. When one becomes an authority by nature, one apprehends the meaning of reality just as it is.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bdag nyid nyams su myong ba rnam par dag pa'i kun rdzob pa'i rgyu las nges par skyes pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bdag nyid nyams su myong ba rnam par dag pa'i kun rdzob pa'i rgyu las nges par skyes pa /
translated: The illusion-like nondual wisdom is experienced, definitely born from the cause of the pure relative.

original: phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can gyi ye shes kyi snang ba kun rdzob pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon slar ji ltar 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid
analyzed: phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can gyi ye shes kyi snang ba kun rdzob pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon slar ji ltar 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid
translated: The relative appearance of wisdom, which is the nature of great compassion and wisdom, is the dependent origination of phenomena, which is the reversal of the seeds of conceptuality.üîΩ

original: kyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all errors are abandoned, the conventional appearance of pristine wisdom, which has the nature of great compassion and wisdom, arises through the reality of dependent origination, so that the seeds of discursive thought do not arise again.

original: de lta na yang kha cig gis ma rig pa ni rig pas zad par byed la rig pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang kha cig gis ma rig pa ni rig pas zad par byed la rig pa yang don ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin no //
translated: But some say: ‚ÄúKnowledge destroys ignorance, and knowledge is the understanding of things as they are.

original: gal te khyed cag gi ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyang kun rdzob pa yin @239b na de las ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa skyes pa med pa na ma rig pa ji ltar ldog / ci srid du ma rig pa
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gi ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyang kun rdzob pa yin @239b na de las ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa skyes pa med pa na ma rig pa ji ltar ldog / ci srid du ma rig pa
translated: If, according to you, the pristine wisdom of the TathƒÅgata is conventional, then because it has the nature of ignorance, how can ignorance cease when knowledge arises?üîΩAnd as long as ignorance is not abandoned, how can there be liberation?‚Äù

original: ma spangs pa de srid du yang grol bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de yang ma 'brel ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma spangs pa de srid du yang grol bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de yang ma 'brel ba nyid do //
translated: This objection is not relevant.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni rtag pa nyid la sogs par sgro btags pa'i chos rtogs pa yin la de las bzlog pa tshad mas mi gnod pa'i chos rtogs pa ni rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni rtag pa nyid la sogs par sgro btags pa'i chos rtogs pa yin la de las bzlog pa tshad mas mi gnod pa'i chos rtogs pa ni rig pa yin te /
translated: Thus ignorance is the apprehension of phenomena that are imputed to be permanent and so on. The opposite of that is knowledge, the apprehension of phenomena that is not undermined by valid knowledge.

original: des na de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa phyin ci log ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni shin tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa phyin ci log ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni shin tu grags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is well known that the reason for the nonerroneous presentation of those is that they are not undermined by valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob ba nyid yin yang 'gal ba'i chos skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ma don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid kyi rjes su song bas phyin ci log ldog pa na gang gis de ma spangs pa thal bar mi 'thad par gyur pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob ba nyid yin yang 'gal ba'i chos skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ma don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid kyi rjes su song bas phyin ci log ldog pa na gang gis de ma spangs pa thal bar mi 'thad par gyur pa /
translated: Therefore, although they are conventional, because they are phenomena that arise with contradictory properties, the meaning of the term is to follow reality just as it is. When one reverses from error, it is not tenable that one does not abandon it.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rig pa nyid ga las yin te des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rig pa nyid ga las yin te des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: How could the reason for that be knowledge? Therefore this is nonsense.

original: des na da ltar don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid mchog tu de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na da ltar don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid mchog tu de kho na mthong bar 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore now you wish to see the supreme reality of the ultimate nature.

original: mig btsums pa dang dmus long la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rkyen ma tshang ba'am yid la mi byed pas ma mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig btsums pa dang dmus long la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rkyen ma tshang ba'am yid la mi byed pas ma mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that they do not see it because the conditions are incomplete or because they do not pay attention, as is the case with someone with their eyes shut or a blind person.

original: de bas na dngos po la sogs par phyin ci log gi bag chags ma spangs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba dang 'dra bar dngos po la sogs pa phyin ci log pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i nyon mongs ba
analyzed: de bas na dngos po la sogs par phyin ci log gi bag chags ma spangs pas 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba dang 'dra bar dngos po la sogs pa phyin ci log pa'i bag chags las byung ba'i nyon mongs ba
translated: Therefore, because the latent propensities for error with respect to entities and so on have not been eliminated, like rising from the meditative attainment of nonapperception, the latent propensities for error with respect to entities and so on give rise to the afflictions and

original: dang shes bya'i sgrib pa skye ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa ma grol ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang shes bya'i sgrib pa skye ba'i phyir rnal 'byor pa ma grol ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: the obscurations to knowledge. Therefore the yogi would not be liberated.

original: gang gi phyir yang ji skad du bshad pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa kho na grol ba thob par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang ji skad du bshad pa'i de kho na nyid shes pa kho na grol ba thob par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Because only the knowledge of thatness as it has been explained causes the attainment of liberation,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa de'i phyir sngar brjod pa nyid mchog tu de kho na nyid mthong ba yin bar bzung ste /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa de'i phyir sngar brjod pa nyid mchog tu de kho na nyid mthong ba yin bar bzung ste /
translated: and because it would be absurd if it were otherwise, therefore the previously stated view is the best view of thatness.

original: des nyes pa thams cad dang 'gal ba bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du byas par gyur ba na de dang 'gal ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang sgrib pa rnams spong bar byed do //üîΩde'i phyir gegs byed bas sprin la sogs pa sgrib g-yogs dang bral ba'i nam mkha' la nyi ma'i 'od bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po de kho na skye ba la sogs par rtog pa dang bral ba thams cad la rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum
analyzed: des nyes pa thams cad dang 'gal ba bdag med pa mthong ba mngon sum du byas par gyur ba na de dang 'gal ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang sgrib pa rnams spong bar byed do // de'i phyir gegs byed bas sprin la sogs pa sgrib g-yogs dang bral ba'i nam mkha' la nyi ma'i 'od bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dngos po de kho na skye ba la sogs par rtog pa dang bral ba thams cad la rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum
translated: When the yogi directly perceives selflessness, which is incompatible with all faults, he eliminates all afflictions and obscurations because they are incompatible with that.

original: gyi ye shes kyi snang ba thogs pa med par 'jug go //
analyzed: gyi ye shes kyi snang ba thogs pa med par 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, like the sun‚Äôs rays in the sky free from obscuring clouds, the yogi‚Äôs direct gnosis, free from the obstruction of the afflictions, enters without obstruction into all things, dependent originations, free from the conception of arising and so on.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa @240a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa @240a * //
translated: Thus the nature of consciousness is to illuminate the nature of things.

original: yin pa de ni gegs byed pa yod pa las dngos po nye bar yin yang gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur gyi gegs byed pa med par gyur na go shes bya bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa'i khyad par thob pa las dngos po mtha' dag gsal bar
analyzed: yin pa de ni gegs byed pa yod pa las dngos po nye bar yin yang gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur gyi gegs byed pa med par gyur na go shes bya bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i nus pa'i khyad par thob pa las dngos po mtha' dag gsal bar
translated: That is, it is not the case that the thing is not clearly manifest due to the presence of an obstruction, but that it is clearly manifest when the obstruction is removed.

original: byed pa kho nar ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byed pa kho nar ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: How could it not be the case that all things are clearly manifest due to the attainment of the special capacity of inconceivable knowledge?

original: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gyi dngos po ma lus pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gyi dngos po ma lus pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of thoroughly knowing all things of the conventional and ultimate modes just as they are, the state of omniscience is attained.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa'i lam gyi dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa'i lam gyi dam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the supreme path for abandoning all obscurations and realizing omniscience.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te sgyu ma la de dag ni sgyu ma byed pa bzhin du grags pa tsam nyid dang bden pa nyid ma yin par ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir na dngos po
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams las rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te sgyu ma la de dag ni sgyu ma byed pa bzhin du grags pa tsam nyid dang bden pa nyid ma yin par ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir na dngos po
translated: The difference between the yogis and ordinary beings is this: the yogis, like the magicians, know that the illusions are just what is renowned, and not real.

original: rnams la bden pa nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed de de bas na de dag la rnal 'byor pa zhes brjod do ;
analyzed: rnams la bden pa nyid du mngon par zhen par mi byed de de bas na de dag la rnal 'byor pa zhes brjod do ;
translated: Therefore, they do not conceive of things as real. Therefore, they are called ‚Äúyogis.‚Äù

original: / gang dag byis pa'i skye bo ltad mo ba sgyu ma la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du dngos po la yang phyin ci log tu mngon par zhes pas de dag la byis pa zhes brjod de des na thams cad mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: / gang dag byis pa'i skye bo ltad mo ba sgyu ma la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du dngos po la yang phyin ci log tu mngon par zhes pas de dag la byis pa zhes brjod de des na thams cad mi 'gal lo //
translated: Those who are like the childish spectators, who are attached to the illusions, are also attached to things in the same mistaken way. Therefore, they are called ‚Äúchildish.‚Äù Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: de bas na lung dang rigs pa dag gis sgyu ma lta bur gnyis su med pa'i sems kyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa /
analyzed: de bas na lung dang rigs pa dag gis sgyu ma lta bur gnyis su med pa'i sems kyi de kho na nyid yongs su shes pa /
translated: Therefore, through scripture and reasoning, the yogis fully understand the suchness of the nondual mind, which is like an illusion.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa la mngon par brtson pa'i blo can rnams kyis gnyis su med pa sgyu ma lta bu'i sems yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa la mngon par brtson pa'i blo can rnams kyis gnyis su med pa sgyu ma lta bu'i sems yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Those who are endowed with intelligence and are intent on realizing suchness, having established the illusory nondual mind, the nature of the correct relative, with the wisdom arisen from hearing and reflection,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtog pa brgyad kyi rim par gus pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang dus yun ring po'i khyad par can gyi bsgom pas sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtog pa brgyad kyi rim par gus pa dang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang dus yun ring po'i khyad par can gyi bsgom pas sgom par byed pa'i rnal 'byor
translated: then cultivate it with meditation that is special in terms of respect, continuity, and length of time, in the sequence of the eight realizations, such as the knowledge of all aspects of the reality of dependent origination.

original: pa'i dbang phyug rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag dang bral zhing srid pa ji srid par rjes su 'brel pa /
analyzed: pa'i dbang phyug rnams ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag dang bral zhing srid pa ji srid par rjes su 'brel pa /
translated: The lords of yoga, who are free from all conceptual thoughts of the reality of dependent origination, who are connected to it for as long as existence continues,

original: rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rgyun sgyu ma lta bu thob bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam gyi rgyun sgyu ma lta bu thob bar byed do //
translated: attain the illusory continuum of consciousness alone.

original: de nyid ni gnyen po'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni gnyen po'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: That is the principal antidote.

original: dang po sgyu ma lta bu zhes rnam par 'jog par byed pa mngon par brjod pa dang bcas pa ni de'i rjes su mthun pa yin gyi gnyen po nyid du gyur ba ni ma yin no//
analyzed: dang po sgyu ma lta bu zhes rnam par 'jog par byed pa mngon par brjod pa dang bcas pa ni de'i rjes su mthun pa yin gyi gnyen po nyid du gyur ba ni ma yin no//
translated: The first, the formulation ‚Äúlike an illusion,‚Äù is consistent with that, but it is not the antidote itself.

original: @240b 'di ltar phyi'i don gyi tshul la gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin sems la 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @240b 'di ltar phyi'i don gyi tshul la gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin sems la 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In the external object theory, the cultivation of the selflessness of persons, etc. does not establish the nature of things in the mind,

original: dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang dang po med pa'i phyir te yod na bsgom ba don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang dang po med pa'i phyir te yod na bsgom ba don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because things are to be realized by a nonconceptual mind, and because that is not the first, since if it were, cultivation would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir der yang pha rol po 'di ming tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de kho na nyid la sems gtod pa dang rjes su mthun pa la brten pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir der yang pha rol po 'di ming tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de kho na nyid la sems gtod pa dang rjes su mthun pa la brten pa /
translated: Therefore, in that case, the opponent is merely attached to the name, and the mind is focused on reality in the reflection of the conceptual image that is consistent with that.

original: dngos por lhag par zhen pa can gyis mgu ba yin na der ming gi rnam pa goms pa las brjod pa 'phel bar ci ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos por lhag par zhen pa can gyis mgu ba yin na der ming gi rnam pa goms pa las brjod pa 'phel bar ci ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is pleasing to those who are attached to the reality of things, why would the expression not increase from the practice of the form of the name?

original: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa ni rim gyis rnam par rtog pa sdud do zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo ba med pa ni rim gyis rnam par rtog pa sdud do zhe na /
translated: If the internal self is unmoving, it gradually collects the conceptual thoughts.

original: de ltar na gzhan la yang 'di mtshungs te shin tu spros pas chog go //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan la yang 'di mtshungs te shin tu spros pas chog go //
translated: In that case, it is the same for others. Enough of this extensive discussion.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad du yid du 'ong ba'i de bzhin nyid de bstan pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi stobs kyis mtshan ma byung bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad du yid du 'ong ba'i de bzhin nyid de bstan pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi stobs kyis mtshan ma byung bar gyur to zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate the suchness that is always pleasing, it is said that the signs arose by the power of reality.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'di bstan pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'di bstan pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When this suchness of the Tathagata was being taught, and so on.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba drug dang ltas chen po bco brgyad du zhes bya ba ni bye ba'i khyad par gyis gcig gi tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba drug dang ltas chen po bco brgyad du zhes bya ba ni bye ba'i khyad par gyis gcig gi tshig go //
translated: The six transformations and the eighteen great signs is a singular expression with a particular meaning.

original: de la rnam par 'gyur ba drug ni snod kyi 'jig rten la sa chen po mngon par 'dus byas pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du g-yo ba dang mtho ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par 'gyur ba drug ni snod kyi 'jig rten la sa chen po mngon par 'dus byas pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i dbang du byas nas go rims bzhin du g-yo ba dang mtho ba yin no //
translated: The six transformations are: the shaking, trembling, and quaking of the great earth in the receptacle world, in the order of the manifest and unmanifest.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten la ni sems can gyi ris rnam pa bzhi ste /

translated: Therefore, since the objects of the sense organs do not exist in that way, the nature of the sense organs is the five kinds of roots of virtue that are compatible with liberation, which are faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.üîΩ

original: rnam par @243a * //

translated: ‚ÄúOne should give‚Äù means one should give with its fruit.

original: chos yang dag par rtogs pas zab mo'i chos la som nyi mi byed pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos yang dag par rtogs pas zab mo'i chos la som nyi mi byed pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of not doubting the profound Dharma through correct realization of the Dharma is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúFurthermore, Subhuti, etc.

original: de la lam gzhan 'dod cing @249a * //
analyzed: de la lam gzhan 'dod cing @249a * //
translated: Therein, one desires another path,

original: mthar thug pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ne ma nur ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ne ma nur ro //
translated: and because it is endless, it is doubt.

original: lam drang po las bzlog pa ni yid gnyis so //
analyzed: lam drang po las bzlog pa ni yid gnyis so //
translated: The opposite of the straight path is doubt.

original: dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel bar 'gro ba med pas rigs kyi chos gso ba ma yin pas na the tshom ste gsor med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'phel bar 'gro ba med pas rigs kyi chos gso ba ma yin pas na the tshom ste gsor med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no increase in various kinds of virtue, it is not the healing of the Dharma of the family, and so it is incurable.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa dang bral bas na rmongs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa dang bral bas na rmongs pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is completely devoid of realization, it is just delusion.

original: gzhan la phan pa nyid du zhugs pas byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa'i don ni de phan pa'i tshig dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa nyid du zhugs pas byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang ldan pa'i don ni de phan pa'i tshig dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of being endowed with the body, speech, and mind of love that is engaged in benefiting others is stated in the verse beginning with ‚Äúhaving words of benefit.‚Äù

original: de la byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pas ma 'ongs pa na phan par smra bas na phan pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pas ma 'ongs pa na phan par smra bas na phan pa'i tshig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, since one speaks of benefit in the future through being endowed with the body karma of love, one has words of benefit.

original: de bzhin du ngag gi las dam pa dang ldan pas tshig tshad yod par smra ba'i phyir tshig ran par smra ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag gi las dam pa dang ldan pas tshig tshad yod par smra ba'i phyir tshig ran par smra ba'o //
translated: Similarly, since one speaks words that are measured through being endowed with excellent speech karma, one speaks words that are measured.

original: byams pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba nyid kyis na rnar snyan pa la sogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshig 'jam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byams pas yongs su bsgos pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba nyid kyis na rnar snyan pa la sogs par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshig 'jam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because it is motivated by a mind completely suffused with loving kindness, it is gentle speech, since it is pleasant to hear, etc.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas sgrib pa lnga po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dag dang mi 'grogs ba'i don nye bar mtshon ba nyid du gsungs pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas sgrib pa lnga po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dag dang mi 'grogs ba'i don nye bar mtshon ba nyid du gsungs pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The statement that it is the indication of the perfection of application, since it is not accompanied by the five hindrances‚Äîdesire, malice, sleepiness and drowsiness, excitation and regret, and doubt‚Äîis the statement that it is the destruction of sleepiness and drowsiness.

original: gnyen po rnam par bsgoms pa nyid kyis ma rig pa la sogs pa'i bag la nyal thams cad 'joms pa'i don ni bag la nyal med bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam par bsgoms pa nyid kyis ma rig pa la sogs pa'i bag la nyal thams cad 'joms pa'i don ni bag la nyal med bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The statement that it is the destruction of all the latent propensities for ignorance, etc., by the cultivation of the antidote is the statement that it is the destruction of latent propensities.

original: de lam rig pa dang lta ba'i zag bas bsdus pa'i bdag la nyal ba med pa nyid yin gyi 'dod pa dang srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lam rig pa dang lta ba'i zag bas bsdus pa'i bdag la nyal ba med pa nyid yin gyi 'dod pa dang srid pa'i zag pas bsdus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the self that is included in the defilements of desire and existence,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsams bzhin du srid pa len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsams bzhin du srid pa len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the bodhisattva intentionally takes up existence.

original: rtag tu ma nyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis na dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i don ni /
analyzed: rtag tu ma nyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis na dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of being endowed with mindfulness and introspection through always being in a state of composure is

original: de 'ong ngam 'gro ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'ong ngam 'gro ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: stated in the verse: Whether he is coming or going, etc.

original: de la 'ong ba ni mngon sum du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'ong ba ni mngon sum du 'ong ba'o //
translated: There, coming is coming into the present.

original: 'gro ba ni phar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni phar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going is going away.

original: sems 'khrul pas 'gro ba'am 'ong ba ma yin pa ni shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'khrul pas 'gro ba'am 'ong ba ma yin pa ni shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not go or come with a confused mind, because he is endowed with introspection.

original: dran ba nye bar gzhag ba ni yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran ba nye bar gzhag ba ni yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is endowed with right mindfulness because he is endowed with the foundations of mindfulness.

original: spyod lam nyams pa yongs su spang ba'i don gyis na thogs par mi byed pa ste shin tu dal ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam nyams pa yongs su spang ba'i don gyis na thogs par mi byed pa ste shin tu dal ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: He does not move too quickly, in the sense of avoiding a lapse in deportment.

original: bde @249b ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i rang bzhin du mngon par rtogs par brtson par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde @249b ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i rang bzhin du mngon par rtogs par brtson par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is intent on realizing the nature of peace, in the sense of being intent on realizing the nature of tranquility.

original: rkang pa gya tshom du sa las mi 'degs zhes bya ba ni rkang pa gcig legs par ma gzhag par rkang pa gnyis pa mi 'degs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkang pa gya tshom du sa las mi 'degs zhes bya ba ni rkang pa gcig legs par ma gzhag par rkang pa gnyis pa mi 'degs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not lift his foot too quickly, in the sense of not lifting the second foot before the first is well placed.

original: rkang pa gya tshom dus la mi 'jog zhes bya ba ni srog chags dang bcas pa'i sa phyogs spang ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gya tshom dus la mi 'jog zhes bya ba ni srog chags dang bcas pa'i sa phyogs spang ba'i don du'o //
translated: He does not place his foot too slowly, in the sense of avoiding places where there are living beings.

original: kun tu spyod pa gzob pa nyid kyis gos la sogs pa yongs su spyod pa gtsang ba zhes bya ba'i don ni yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa gzob pa nyid kyis gos la sogs pa yongs su spyod pa gtsang ba zhes bya ba'i don ni yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the purity of his use of robes and so on, in the sense of the purity of his use of them due to his general conscientiousness, is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚ÄúSubhuti, when the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, puts on his robe.‚Äù

original: gnod pa nyung bar 'gyur ba ni nad nyung ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa nyung bar 'gyur ba ni nad nyung ba'o //
translated: He has few troubles, in the sense of having few illnesses.

original: skyon nyung bar 'gyur ba ni gzhan gyi 'tshe ba nyung ba'o //
analyzed: skyon nyung bar 'gyur ba ni gzhan gyi 'tshe ba nyung ba'o //
translated: The lesser of the faults is the lesser harm from others.

original: de ltar na de dag ni dro bar gtogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rnam pa bcu gcig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni dro bar gtogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rnam pa bcu gcig tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the eleven aspects of the stage of heat.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa nyid kyis na lus la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri mi 'byung ba'i don ni sems can gzhan dag gis lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa nyid kyis na lus la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri mi 'byung ba'i don ni sems can gzhan dag gis lus la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the non-arising of the eighty-four thousand types of worms in the body due to the roots of virtue that are exalted above all worlds is stated in the line ‚Äúother sentient beings do not have worms in their bodies.‚Äù

original: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni phra rab tsam gyi tshul gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad nas zhes bya ba ni phra rab tsam gyi tshul gyis kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means even in the manner of atoms.

original: thams cad ni srin bu'i rigs rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ni srin bu'i rigs rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to the types of worms.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù refers to their color and so forth.

original: thams cad ni srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri grangs su bgrang bar mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ni srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri grangs su bgrang bar mi 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to the eighty-four thousand types of worms.

original: de bzhin du ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya bas dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In the same way, the line ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù anticipates an objection.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus have I heard, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pas sems la gya gyu med pa'i don ci lta ci lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pas sems la gya gyu med pa'i don ci lta ci lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of a mind without crookedness due to the purity of the roots of virtue is stated by in whatever way, etc.

original: de la lus yongs su dag pa ni lus la mtshan la sogs pas yongs su brgyan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la lus yongs su dag pa ni lus la mtshan la sogs pas yongs su brgyan pa nyid do //
translated: There, the purity of the body is the very adornment of the body with the major marks, etc.

original: dag yongs su dag pa ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dag yongs su dag pa ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The purity of speech is the very nature of the Brahma-voice, etc.

original: gnyis po 'di dag ni sems yongs su dag pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin par bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag ni sems yongs su dag pa'i 'bras bu nyid yin par bshad do //
translated: These two are explained as the fruit of the purity of mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtso bo yin pas sems yongs su dag pa rnam par 'byed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtso bo yin pas sems yongs su dag pa rnam par 'byed pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of their preeminence, the request for the analysis of the purity of mind is made by Blessed One, how should the purity of the mind be known?

original: de la rnyed pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir sems la bya ba nyung ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnyed pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir sems la bya ba nyung ba'o //
translated: There, fewness of activities of mind is due to the absence of concern for gain, etc.üîΩ üîΩAbsence of mental proliferation is due to the absence of the proliferation of the mind.

original: yang dag pa'i skyon la yongs su sbed pa med pas na sems g-yo ba med pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan @250a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon la yongs su sbed pa med pas na sems g-yo ba med pa'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan @250a * //
translated: The mind is unmoving because it is not concealed from the faults of reality.

original: ston pa dang bral bas sems sgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang bral bas sems sgyu med pa'o //
translated: The mind is without deceit because it is free from the display of unreal virtues.

original: yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du smra ba nyid yin pas na sems la gya gyu med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du smra ba nyid yin pas na sems la gya gyu med pa'o //
translated: The mind is without crookedness because it is the teaching of reality just as it is.

original: ser sna la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sems yon po med pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir sems yon po med pa'o //
translated: The mind is without corruption because it is free from stinginess and so on.

original: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la gzhol bas so //
analyzed: gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la gzhol bas so //
translated: The phrase whatever it is refers to the Great Vehicle.

original: rang pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa la mi lta ba nyid kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par len pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa la mi lta ba nyid kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par len pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of taking up the twelve ascetic virtues is stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúMoreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in this deep perfection of wisdom, should not stand in form, etc.‚Äù

original: de la rnyed pa ni rdzas thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnyed pa ni rdzas thob pa'o //
translated: There, gain is the acquisition of property.

original: bkur sti ni gces spras byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: bkur sti ni gces spras byed pa nyid do //
translated: Honor is the esteeming of one.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //
translated: Verse is fame.

original: lhur mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhur mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He does not make an effort means he does not apply himself to that.

original: de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The twelve ascetic practices are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa nyid dang / thams cad 'phying ba pa nyid dang / bsod nams pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid dang / dgon pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa nyid dang / thams cad 'phying ba pa nyid dang / bsod nams pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid dang / dgon pa nyid dang /
translated: the practice of wearing robes made of rags, the practice of wearing robes made of three pieces of cloth, the practice of sitting in one place, the practice of eating in one place, the practice of eating in one sitting, the practice of not eating after the proper time, the practice of living in a charnel ground,

original: shing drung ba nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang / gcog pu ba nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: shing drung ba nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang / gcog pu ba nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: the practice of living at the foot of a tree, the practice of living in the open air, the practice of living in a cave, and the practice of living wherever one happens to be.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bsgrubs pas pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs ba'i sems mi bskyed pa'i don ni phrag dog dang ser sna mang ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par bsgrubs pas pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs ba'i sems mi bskyed pa'i don ni phrag dog dang ser sna mang ba ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of not being envious and not being greedy is that he does not arouse a greedy mind that is, a mind of avarice, etc. which is the opposite of the perfections such as generosity, since he has attained the excellence of generosity, etc.

original: nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: Since this is an illustration,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzung ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzung ngo //
translated: He has taken up the resistances to all the perfections.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir chos nyid dang mi 'gal pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor rtogs pa'i don ni chos zab mo dag bshad pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir chos nyid dang mi 'gal pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor rtogs pa'i don ni chos zab mo dag bshad pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te
translated: The meaning of the yoga of the perfection of wisdom that does not contradict reality is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúWhen the profound doctrine is being taught‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhe should not be afraid.‚Äù

original: / bskyod par bya bar mi nus pas na blo brtan pa'o //
analyzed: / bskyod par bya bar mi nus pas na blo brtan pa'o //
translated: He is of firm intellect because he cannot be shaken.

original: phra ba'i don mthong bas na blo zab pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i don mthong bas na blo zab pa'o //
translated: He is of profound intellect because he sees the meaning of the subtle.

original: sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: He applies himself means he applies himself correctly.

original: sems can gyi khams bdag gir byas pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du dmyal ba 'dod pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams bdag gir byas pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du dmyal ba 'dod pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of his desire for the hells for the sake of others is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, Subhuti‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhe should not be afraid.‚Äù

original: phyir bshags par gyis shig ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bzung ba yongs su 'dor bas so //
analyzed: phyir bshags par gyis shig ces bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bzung ba yongs su 'dor bas so //
translated: The phrase you should confess them means that you should give up the attitude of rejecting the spirit of enlightenment.

original: so sor spongs shig ces bya ba ni phyis kyang mi bskyed @250b pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems mi 'khrugs pa ni 'dren ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor spongs shig ces bya ba ni phyis kyang mi bskyed @250b pa'i phyir ro // sems mi 'khrugs pa ni 'dren ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase you should abandon them means that you should not generate them again in the future.üîΩThe phrase you should not be disturbed means that you should not be mixed with the spiritual lineages of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: mi g-yo ba ni yongs su blangs pa mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni yongs su blangs pa mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase you should not waver means that you should not give up your commitment.

original: de ltar na de dag gi rtse mor gtogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //üîΩrtogs pa yid ches pa'i chos nyid kyi gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gi rtse mor gtogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro // rtogs pa yid ches pa'i chos nyid kyi gzhan gyis bkrir mi btub pa'i don ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, there are six aspects to the stage of the highest common practice.üîΩThe phrase Subhuti, furthermore, and so on, indicates the topic of the unchangeability of the spirit of enlightenment, which is the unchangeability of the spirit of enlightenment in the face of the four conditions of being taught the emptiness of all things, and so on.

original: chos nyid la ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir de skad smos pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid la ston te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir de skad smos pa yin no //
translated: The four phrases beginning with the reality of things refer to the realization of the illusion-like nature of the truths of suffering and so on.

original: gzhan gyis dad pa'i phyir mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba ni chos nyid mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir gzhan la yid ches pas rtogs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dad pa'i phyir mi 'gro ste zhes bya ba ni chos nyid mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir gzhan la yid ches pas rtogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He does not go for the sake of others' faith, because he has realized reality, and so he is not one who has realized it through faith in others.

original: 'di dag nyid dpes gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid dpes gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illustrate just these,

original: rab 'byor dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /

translated: There, the antidote to the impurity of the world of sentient beings, such as hunger, is the establishment of the purity of divine enjoyments, and so on. translated: Because that moment of mind is ultimately unborn, and conventionally it is endowed with a long duration, it is without beginning, since it is devoid of an initial cause.

analyzed: de bzhin nyid kho na ldog pa'i dbye bas ji ltar zad pa dang mi 'byung ba la sogs pa bstan pas de ltar bshad pa yin no //
translated: Suchness itself is explained in that way by way of the divisions of the negations, just as the teaching of the exhaustion of the appropriated aggregates and so on is explained.

original: ji ltar gzhan la slob pa na gzhan dag la slob par byed ces 'dri ba ni bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la slob pa na gzhan dag la slob par byed ces 'dri ba ni bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol pa yin no //
translated: The question, ‚ÄúHow, when training in others, does one train in others?‚Äù is stated by ‚ÄúBhagavan, why is that?‚Äù and so on.

original: rab 'byor gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i tshig bzlas nas slar 'dri ba'i sgo nas lan btab pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang 'di skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i tshig bzlas nas slar 'dri ba'i sgo nas lan btab pa ni rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, having repeated the words if one says and so on, answers by way of a counter-question: Subhuti, what do you think? and so on.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Suchness means omniscience and buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das zad pa ni zad par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas bcom ldan 'das zad pa ni zad par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba gsol te /
translated: Similarly, why is that? anticipating the doubt, he says, Bhagavan, the exhaustion of something does not become exhausted.

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad pas na 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad pas na 'tshang rgya ba nyid ni zad pa'o //
translated: Here, because all conceptualization is exhausted, buddhahood itself is exhaustion.

original: chos kyi dbyings zad pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya ste de'i bdag nyid du 'brel pas zad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zad pa dang bral ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi zad pa zhes bya ste de'i bdag nyid du 'brel pas zad pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the dharmadhatu is free from exhaustion, it is called inexhaustible. By the connection to its nature, the nature of exhaustion and so on is omniscience. This is the meaning.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa las bzlog pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The words will not arise and so on are to be understood as the opposite of the words will arise and so on.

original: yongs su dag pa la bslabs pa nyid kyi phan yon bstan pa ni rab 'byor de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa la bslabs pa nyid kyi phan yon bstan pa ni rab 'byor de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The benefits of training in purification are taught beginning with Subhuti, for that reason...

original: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor gang 'di la slob pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //üîΩde la bya ba'i @286a * //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu nas rab 'byor gang 'di la slob pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // de la bya ba'i @286a * //
translated: Why is it so? is a question anticipating the doubt of the former. The answer is given beginning with Subhuti, those who train in this...

original: rigs zhes bya ba ni 'dab chags gsod pa rnams so //
analyzed: rigs zhes bya ba ni 'dab chags gsod pa rnams so //
translated: Among them, the class of butchers refers to those who kill birds.

original: rngon pa ni ri dags la sogs pa gsod pa rnams so //
analyzed: rngon pa ni ri dags la sogs pa gsod pa rnams so //
translated: Hunters are those who kill deer and so on.

original: nya pha ni nya gsod pa rnams so //
analyzed: nya pha ni nya gsod pa rnams so //
translated: Fishermen are those who kill fish.

original: shan pa ni sha 'tshong bar byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: shan pa ni sha 'tshong bar byed pa rnams so //
translated: Butchers are those who sell meat.

original: long ba dang 'on pa ni mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: long ba dang 'on pa ni mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Blind and deaf refers to those lacking the eye and ear consciousnesses.

original: nar ba ni mig gcig dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nar ba ni mig gcig dang bral ba'o //
translated: The one-eyed person is one who is missing one eye.

original: rdum po ni lag pa la sogs pa bcad pa'o //
analyzed: rdum po ni lag pa la sogs pa bcad pa'o //
translated: The crippled person is one whose hands and so on are cut off.

original: sgur po ni rgyab yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'thing bo ni byin pa mi mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sgur po ni rgyab yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro // 'thing bo ni byin pa mi mnyam pa yin no //
translated: The hunchback is one whose back is bent.üîΩThe lame person is one whose legs are cut off.

original: zha bo ni gru mo'i tshigs kyi gong thung ba'o //
analyzed: zha bo ni gru mo'i tshigs kyi gong thung ba'o //
translated: The dwarf is one whose legs are not fully developed.
